what: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: PremPredict package helps generate sensible predictions individual games entire season Premier League. can find automatically-updated Premier League predictor (uses codebase) landing page repo.

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: can install development version PremPredict GitHub :

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: use simplified version David Firth’s approach data Open Football repo GitHub predict outcome season’s Premier League. predictions based team’s strength, given performance recent times. define recent? order duck question, choose number different time periods. Please note 0.0% 100.0% outcomes results necessarily signify certainty specific assessment, : model typically used 1,000 simulations; pertinently model (like models) imperfect (, think, better model )

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: example analysis, using data collected 12th May 2025 (wasn’t quite date ). First, collect, combine tidy results data. However, wish look back full year current point (team small number games remaining season). number rows isn’t 380, games season yet played games last year didn’t feature teams season (three teams promoted Championship). reference, can see prevailing table. can now model strengths sides home away. [add details explanation due course.] Next, use team strengths model future games across season. basis, Liverpool look like strong favourites win season (actually ). However, project likelihood , need simulate many possible outcomes. [follow.]
code: library(PremPredict) data("example_thisSeason")  results_combined <- get_results(example_thisSeason, seasons = 1L) dim(results_combined) #> [1] 652   9 game_latest <- calc_game_latest(results = results_combined)  results_filtered <- get_results_filtered(   results = results_combined,    index_game_latest = game_latest,    lookback_rounds = 38L   )  dplyr::glimpse(results_filtered) #> Rows: 433 #> Columns: 8 #> $ matchday <date> 2024-04-06, 2024-04-06, 2024-04-07, 2024-04-07, 2024-04-13, … #> $ homeTeam <chr> "WOL", "BRI", "MUN", "TOT", "NEW", "NOT", "BOU", "LIV", "WHU"… #> $ awayTeam <chr> "WHU", "ARS", "LIV", "NOT", "TOT", "WOL", "MUN", "CPA", "FUL"… #> $ FTHG     <dbl> 1, 0, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2, 0, 0, 0, 6, 0, 2, 3, 5, 1, 5, 0, 2, 2, 0… #> $ FTAG     <dbl> 2, 3, 2, 1, 0, 2, 2, 1, 2, 2, 0, 2, 0, 1, 2, 3, 0, 1, 0, 0, 4… #> $ FTR      <chr> "A", "A", "D", "H", "H", "D", "D", "A", "A", "A", "H", "A", "… #> $ played   <lgl> TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, T… #> $ match    <chr> "220", "221", "222", "223", "224", "225", "226", "227", "228"… data_table_current <- example_thisSeason |>    calc_table_current()  data_table_current |>    print_table_current() data_model <- results_filtered |>    model_prepare_frame() |>   model_run()  data_model #>  #> Call: #> gnm::gnm(formula = count ~ -1 + s + draw, eliminate = match,  #>     family = stats::quasipoisson, data = modelframe, start = rep(0,  #>         2 * nTeams + 1)) #>  #> Coefficients of interest: #> sARS_home  sAST_home  sBOU_home  sBRE_home  sBRI_home  sCHE_home  sCPA_home   #>   2.11616    1.80472    0.83416    0.91304    0.54456    2.10914    0.91035   #> sEVE_home  sFUL_home  sIPS_home  sLEI_home  sLIV_home  sMCI_home  sMUN_home   #>   0.95829    0.62203   -2.27916   -1.22314    2.77280    2.07414    0.50124   #> sNEW_home  sNOT_home  sSOU_home  sTOT_home  sWHU_home  sWOL_home  sARS_away   #>   1.78552    1.27272   -2.91937    0.48145    0.01834   -0.42682    1.99077   #> sAST_away  sBOU_away  sBRE_away  sBRI_away  sCHE_away  sCPA_away  sEVE_away   #>   0.72014    0.68944    0.51242    0.70031    1.08462    1.07638   -0.09467   #> sFUL_away  sIPS_away  sLEI_away  sLIV_away  sMCI_away  sMUN_away  sNEW_away   #>   0.97085   -0.18998   -1.37943    1.87401    1.59837    0.10322    0.93390   #> sNOT_away  sSOU_away  sTOT_away  sWHU_away  sWOL_away       draw   #>   0.94902   -2.17842   -0.40044    0.21730    0.34709         NA   #>  #> Deviance:            698.4004  #> Pearson chi-squared: 763.8907  #> Residual df:         722 data_parameters_unplayed <- data_model |>    model_extract_parameters()  data_points_expected_remaining <- model_parameters_unplayed(   results = results_filtered,   model_parameters = data_parameters_unplayed   ) |>    calc_points_expected_remaining()  calc_points_expected_total(   table_current = data_table_current,   points_expected = data_points_expected_remaining   ) #> # A tibble: 20 × 2 #>    midName        Exp_Points_Ave #>    <chr>                   <dbl> #>  1 Liverpool                88.7 #>  2 Arsenal                  75.9 #>  3 Man City                 69.1 #>  4 Newcastle                67.7 #>  5 Notts Forest             67.5 #>  6 Chelsea                  65.5 #>  7 Aston Villa              64.7 #>  8 Bournemouth              55.8 #>  9 Fulham                   55.5 #> 10 Brighton                 54.7 #> 11 Brentford                54.3 #> 12 Crystal Palace           50.1 #> 13 Everton                  44.4 #> 14 Man Utd                  43.1 #> 15 West Ham                 43.1 #> 16 Wolves                   43.1 #> 17 Tottenham                42.2 #> 18 Ipswich                  24.9 #> 19 Leicester                22.5 #> 20 Southampton              12.7

text: data frame many rows (one game season) 10 variables: number_match character index game question number_match_integer integer version number_match matchday date game occurred homeTeam shortName team played home match awayTeam shortName team played away match FTHG goals scored team played home match FTAG goals scored team played away match FTR result match, factor "" (away win), "D" (draw) "H" (home win) played logical indicating game played yet year_end calendar year season ended
